textBeforeTable: Playlist Tracks:  Ellie also also writes for Lavender Magazine, is a lawyer and the Executive Director of Call for Justice LLC a project dedicated to eliminating barriers that prevent individuals and families in Hennepin and Ramsey Counties from accessing resources to meet their legal needs.  I wrote Getting to Ellen because I believe others can be helped by knowing that you—and you alone—have the power to change your life. Certainly, changing genders is a bit on the extreme side, and not something undertaken lightly. But many are caught in the wrong job or career or wrong marriage or living arrangement. Some suffer from addictions or other adverse behaviors because they’re unhappy with their situation. In short, we humans have a tendency to build lives that aren’t necessarily what we’d choose if we could do it all over again. Some of this—as Getting to Ellen explores—is because of fear and a desire to avoid making hard decisions. Some of it is due to immaturity; we simply
